intro.p: The region D in the xy-plane, shown below, is bounded by {{linetext}} the graphs {{graph1}} and {{graph2}}.

content.p: Sketch a representative vertical cross-section of D.
Then, give a description of D as a "Type-1" region, that is, by finding functions f(x), g(x) and constants a,b so that the points (x,y)\in D exactly consist of those for which
f(x) \leq y \leq g(x) and a\leq x \leq b.
(If your description requires splitting the region into more than one piece, give bounds for each piece.)
Sketch a representative horizontal cross-section of D.
Then, give a description of D as a "Type-2" region, that is, by finding functions F(y), G(y) and constants c,d so that the points (x,y)\in D exactly consist of those for which
F(y) \leq x \leq G(y) and c\leq y \leq d.
(If your description requires splitting the region into more than one piece, give bounds for each piece.)
